verses.verse: (God’s Blessings in the Home) A Song of Ascents. Of Solomon. (Ps 78.69; 121.4) Unless the LORD builds the house, those who build it labor in vain. Unless the LORD guards the city, the guard keeps watch in vain.

(Gen 3.17; Job 11.18, 19) It is in vain that you rise up early and go late to rest, eating the bread of anxious toil, for he gives sleep to his beloved. (Or for he provides for his beloved during sleep)
(Gen 33.5; Deut 28.4; Josh 24.3, 4) Sons are indeed a heritage from the LORD, the fruit of the womb a reward.
Like arrows in the hand of a warrior are the sons of one’s youth.
(Job 5.4; Prov 27.11) Happy is the man who has his quiver full of them. He shall not be put to shame when he speaks with his enemies in the gate.
